2023-05-01.name: Milwaukee Film Festival
2023-05-01.summary: Watch more than 200 films from around the globe, based at the 1927 Oriental Theatre on the East Side.

2023-05-01.name: Homegrown Music Festival
2023-05-01.summary: More than 100 musical acts perform in venues around the Twin Ports, and there also will be film, visual arts and craft beer.

2023-05-04.name: 100-Mile Garage Sale
2023-05-04.summary: This big garage sale is a good excuse to make the scenic, 70-mile drive around this wide spot in the Mississippi, in both Wisconsin and Minnesota.

2023-05-04.summary: This big Dutch heritage fest features daily historical tours, a craft market and afternoon and evening parades.

2023-05-05.summary: Visit artists at 28 studios and sites in and around St. Croix Falls, Osceola and Amery.

2023-05-06.name: Maifest
2023-05-06.summary: There's a lot going on in this former communal society in eastern Iowa â€” a 10 a.m. Saturday parade, polka music, keg-tapping, food-sampling, artisan demonstrations and pony rides.

2023-05-06.summary: More than 6 million tulips bloom during this festival, which this year features a Dutch market, walking tours, tall-ship tours and a carnival.

2023-05-13.name: Doors Open Minneapolis
2023-05-13.summary: Get a free, behind-the-scenes look at 115 historic theaters, hotels, courthouses and mansions as well as new buildings and venues, including Target Field, the Prospect Park water tower and the Pillsbury A Mill. On-site docents lead tours or answer questions.

2023-05-13.name: Blue Ribbon Bacon Festival
2023-05-13.summary: It's all about bacon at this festival at the Iowa State Fairgrounds. There's also live music, a silent disco, cooking demos and a bacon-eating contest.

2023-05-13.name: Midwest Music Fest
2023-05-13.summary: Dozens of musical groups in all genres play in museums, galleries, cafes and arts centers across town. There are arts workshops for children, too.

2023-05-13.name: Spring Festival & Folk Fest
2023-05-13.summary: This Kickapoo Valley village in southwest Wisconsin offers a rodeo, tractor pull, Maypole dancing and a Saturday-night folk concert.

2023-05-13.name: Mushroom Festival
2023-05-13.summary: This northwest Michigan town is morel central in May, celebrating the spring hunt with a carnival, carriage rides, flea market, duck races and a parade at noon Saturday.

2023-05-13.name: Tulip Time
2023-05-13.summary: More than 6 million tulips bloom during this festival, which this year features a Dutch market, walking tours, tall-ship tours and a carnival.

2023-05-13.name: Horicon Marsh Bird Festival
2023-05-13.summary: This large festival in east-central Wisconsin is around a large marsh often called the Everglades of the North. There are bird hikes, bird-banding demonstrations, pontoon-boat tours, canoe and kayak tours, bus tours and a round-the-clock Big Sit, in which participants try to identify as many birds as possible. Register early for field trips.

2023-05-11.name: Tulip Time
2023-05-11.summary: More than 6 million tulips bloom during this festival, which this year features a Dutch market, walking tours, tall-ship tours and a carnival.

2023-05-20.name: National Morel Mushroom Festival
2023-05-20.summary: This town on the east end of Lake Charlevoix celebrates the season with an arts and crafts show, carnival, morel seminars, chef-prepared morsels at Taste of Morels and an evening concert.

2023-05-20.name: Syttende Mai
2023-05-20.summary: The festival in this town south of Madison, which celebrates Norwegian constitution day, is the largest in North America and probably the world. It features Norwegian dancing, Viking games, fjord horses, a canoe race, an arts fair and a big parade at 1:30 p.m. Sunday.

2023-05-20.name: Tulip Festival
2023-05-20.summary: The popular festival in this Dutch town in northwest Iowa celebrates its 82nd anniversary with dance, music, street scrubbing and parades at 2:15 and 6 p.m. daily.

2023-05-20.name: Art-A-Whirl Studio Tour
2023-05-20.summary: Up to 1,000 artists take part in this tour of studios in the northeast Minneapolis arts district.

2023-05-20.name: Festival of Birds
2023-05-20.summary: This festival in northwest Minnesota is near the convergence of prairie with northern pine forest and eastern hardwood forest. Space in field trips to local refuges fills quickly.

2023-05-20.name: Civil War Living History Festival
2023-05-20.summary: In this town near Janesville, this free festival is at the Milton House Museum, once a stop on the Underground Railroad. It features an encampment of soldiers, military drills, cannon firing and an historic walking tour. Sign up in advance for living-history tours of the hotel, where guests will go back to 1861 and meet a freedom-seeker hidden in the cellar.

2023-05-20.name: Trout Days
2023-05-20.summary: This town on the Harmony-Preston Valley State Trail celebrates spring with a car show, kids' pedal pull, live music, fireworks and a parade on Saturday.

2023-05-20.name: Rummage Along the River
2023-05-20.summary: Seventy miles of garage sales will line the Wisconsin side of the Mississippi River from Stoddard, just south of La Crosse, to Lynxville and Mount Sterling.

2023-05-20.name: Duluth Dylan Festival
2023-05-20.summary: The town in which Bob Dylan was born celebrates the singer's 82nd birthday with a Blood on the  Tracks train ride, a singer-songwriter  contest, a bus tour, films, music and a trivia contest.

2023-05-20.name: Syttende Mai
2023-05-20.summary: This Norwegian town, southeast of La Crosse, holds a bicycle tour, troll hunt, rommegrot-eating contest, old-time music, children's tractor pull and a big parade.

2023-05-20.name: Chequamegon Bay Birding & Nature Festival
2023-05-20.summary: Based out of the Northern Great Lakes Visitors Center, activities include bird-banding, hikes and expeditions, hatchery tours and kayaking tours of estuaries.

2023-05-20.name: Syttende Mai
2023-05-20.summary: In Minnesota, Norwegians settled first in this town in bluff country. There's Norwegian food, music and dance, and a big parade at noon Saturday.

2023-05-21.name: Des Plaines River Canoe & Kayak Marathon
2023-05-21.summary: This 18.5-mile race and tour through forest preserves to Mount Prospect is for families and first-timers as well as competitors. There's also a 5.25-mile Minithon, and boats can be rented.

2023-05-25.name: North Iowa Band Festival
2023-05-25.summary: There's a carnival, craft show and car cruise, but don't miss the 10 a.m. Saturday band parade in this northern Iowa town, which Meredith Willson made famous in "The Music Man.''

2023-05-26.name: Duluth Dylan Festival

2023-05-26.name: World's Largest Brat Fest
2023-05-26.summary: There's music on four stages, plus kids' games, a sports zone, carnival rides and Sunday fireworks. Admission is free.  In the Willow Island outside Alliant Energy Center.

2023-05-27.name: Duluth Dylan Festival
2023-05-27.summary: The town in which Bob Dylan was born celebrates the singer's 82nd birthday with a Blood on the  Tracks train ride, a singer-songwriter  contest, a bus tour, films, music and a trivia contest.

2023-05-27.name: Fort Michilimackinac Pageant
2023-05-27.summary: This free pageant  at Colonial Michilimackinac features a cast of more than 400, re-enacting  events that took place between the French, British and Indian tribes on June 2, 1763.

2023-05-27.name: Native American Festival
2023-05-27.summary: This family-friendly festival at the Museum of Ojibwa Culture features drumming, dancing, singing, Ojibwa games, artisan workshops and mass in Ojibwa.

2023-05-27.name: Chicago Suenos Festival
2023-05-27.summary: This second-year Latin-music festival in Grant Park also features Latin food, art installations and a Ferris wheel. It's not free.

2023-05-28.name: Duluth Dylan Festival
2023-05-28.summary: The town in which Bob Dylan was born celebrates the singer's 82nd birthday with a Blood on the  Tracks train ride, a singer-songwriter  contest, a bus tour, films, music and a trivia contest.
